10:57 <Pbas> Hello, I d'on't know if my problem comming from my database access, tomcat, or xwiki 8.2.1 but since 8.2.1 version, get page displayed in 10s instead 400ms  
10:57 <Pbas> did you encoutered that after xwiki upgrade?\*  
10:57 <vmassol1> that's not nice...  
10:57 <vmassol1> don't recall anyone mentioning this though  
10:58 <vmassol1> all pages?  
10:58 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
10:58 <Pbas> ok i must dig better  
10:58 <Pbas> yep  
10:58 <Pbas> I use http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Performances parameters  
10:59 <Pbas> except: -XX:MaxPermSize=222m  
10:59 <Pbas> (must be removed anywy ?)  
10:59 <vmassol> Pbas: read http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Performances#HMemory  
10:59 <vmassol> :)  
11:00 <vmassol> "For Java 8 (i.e. XWiki >= 8.1). Notice that there's no permgen anymore in Java 8:"  
11:01 <Pbas> I used xwiki.org site parameter except MaxPermSize (you must probably update this page because you don't use MaxPermSize anymore I suppose)  
11:07 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:07 <evalica> has quit  
11:08 <blabla2[m]> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <M-mouhb> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <Chris[m]> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <M-jsimard> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <Craeckie[m]> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <aloisdg[m]> has joined #xwiki  
11:13 <Pbas> humm with this http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Performances#HLargenumberofusers it seem better 1,2 s to get a page. Anyway I must wait to see if it is ok now :-)  
11:14 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:14 <Pbas> (I have 296 user in allgroup)  
11:15 <Pbas> need a macro to remove users from XWiki/XWikiAllGroup now ;-)  
11:18 <tmortagne> Pbas: 296 is not enough to explain 10 secondes IMO  
11:18 <tmortagne> s/296/296 users/  
11:19 <Pbas> yes it is what I'm thinking: I must wait a day to see  
11:19 <tmortagne> when you reproduce the 10s try http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Debugging#HElapsedtimetree  
11:20 <Pbas> I think loading page is ok after a tomcat restart but faile after  
11:20 <Pbas> ok ty  
11:20 <tmortagne> might help a bit understanding what make it all slow  
11:20 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:21 <Pbas> ha nice feature!  
11:21 <tmortagne> sometimes it's about a panel doing something wrong or something not very well optimized in the skin  
11:22 <Pbas> maybe but I'm thinking that my tomcat is setting with my foot  
11:23 <Pbas> (fortunely on my dev server)

21:24 <webczat> how to report bugs? where to register for jira?  
21:24 <vmassol> hi webczat  
21:24 <vmassol> see http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Contributing#HReportanissue  
21:25 <webczat> vmassol: but there is no signup link there  
21:26 <webczat> a sorry, ffound it  
21:26 <vmassol> I can assure you there is :)  
21:26 <vmassol> ok cool  
21:26 <Chuguniy> has joined #xwiki  
21:27 <webczat> few more things: first, can xswiki create users in ldap like be a central account database? if no, why not and what is a recommended route in such a case?  
21:27 <vmassol> xwiki doesn't create users in LDAP but it can find existing users in LDAP  
21:27 <vmassol> ie it can log users defined in ldap  
21:28 <vmassol> s/log/log in  
21:28 <webczat> vmassol: you know, if your main site is a xwiki and you want central login, you want account management to create and modify users in ldap itself  
21:28 <webczat> it even did not need to actually authenticate against ldap, but export accounts there  
21:29 <vmassol> if your main site for users is XWiki why do you need LDAP? BTW XWiki can act as an openid server (don't know if that helps you)  
21:29 <vmassol> now I'm not an expert in xwiki ldap :)  
21:29 <webczat> vmassol: if my main site has other non xwiki webapps installed ten I probably need ldap as it is the only thing that all of those apps are guaranteed to support  
21:30 <webczat> vmassol: openid would require some coding.  
21:32 <vmassol> my guess is that what you ask doesn't exist in xwiki, it would need to be coded  
21:33 <M-jsimard> has quit  
21:33 <Chris[m]> has quit  
21:33 <Craeckie[m]> has quit  
21:33 <lynxt> has quit  
21:33 <chaas> has quit  
21:33 <chaas> has joined #xwiki  
21:34 <webczat> vmassol: would it be possible to code it internally as a xwiki page? is there any moment on document creation when user account is created where i get an unencrypted/unhashed password to save to ldap? if it would be possible then it would require less coding than adding things to more than one separate webapps  
21:35 <webczat> unless in general it is better to have separate accounts per webapp  
21:35 <vmassol> I think you'd  simply need to write an authenticator and have 2 steps in it: step 1 would be to save to LDAP and step 2 would be to save to the xwiki store  
21:35 <vmassol> see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication#HCustomAuthentication  
21:37 <webczat> vmassol: not necessarily. there is user creation, there is password changing, etc. unless it would also help?  
21:37 <vmassol> FTR for step2 you'd just piggy back on the standard authenticator  
21:38 <vmassol> (you wouldn't need to write it)  
21:38 <lynxt> has joined #xwiki  
21:38 <vmassol> ah yes  
21:38 <vmassol> I think this is how it's done to sync with LDAP for example  
21:38 <vmassol> you could check how the ldap authenticator is coded  
21:38 <vmassol> (I think it syncs users)  
21:39 <vmassol> (in the autheticator that is)  
21:39 <vmassol> in case you're interested: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/ldap/tree/master/ldap-authenticator/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/ldap  
21:40 <vmassol> " creates XWiki users if they have never logged in before"  
21:40 <vmassol> so on first log in, it does the sync  
21:40 <vmassol> you could do the same  
21:40 <vmassol> on first login in xwiki you'd crate the user in LDAP  
21:40 <vmassol> \*create  
21:40 <Craeckie[m]> has joined #xwiki  
21:40 <M-jsimard> has joined #xwiki  
21:40 <vmassol> (code is here: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/ldap/blob/master/ldap-authenticator/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/ldap/XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl.java )  
21:40 <webczat> vmassol: here it is the other direction. so if I would change user's password it would have an effect on first login after this, and that is bad  
21:41 <vmassol> you've reached the end of my level of knowledge of authenticators in xwiki :)  
21:42 <webczat> same like registering the user would not create anything on ldap until first login  
21:42 <vmassol> you could come back on Monday and I'm sure others might help you. Or you could ask on the mailing list  
21:42 <webczat> vmassol: I have checked the authenticator interface thing, it really only authenticates.  
21:42 <webczat> so, still, not sure what about things like document created event?  
21:44 <webczat> because this place would actually be quite nice for that purpose. sync on user created, sync on user modify sync on user delete. no ldap authenticatiion on login would be needed, but in any case I could in addition sync on login with a real authenticator  
21:45 <webczat> but this would only be needed if there would be a desync  
21:46 <vmassol> there are document events in XWiki indeed: doc created, modified, object added modified, etc  
21:47 <webczat> vmassol: yes. the thing is if you get a cleartext passwor there, or a hash?  
21:47 <vmassol> hash
